text: Éva Novák-Gerard (8 January 1930 - 30 June 2005) was a swimmer from Hungary, and the younger sister of Ilona Novák, who was also a famous swimmer for her native country. She won three medals at the 1952 Summer Olympics in Helsinki, after a bronze four years earlier in London. ==See also== * List of members of the International Swimming Hall of Fame ==References== == External links == * * * * Category:1930 births Category:2005 deaths Category:Female freestyle swimmers Category:Female breaststroke swimmers Category:Hungarian female swimmers Category:Swimmers at the 1948 Summer Olympics Category:Swimmers at the 1952 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic swimmers of Hungary Category:Olympic gold medalists for Hungary Category:Olympic silver medalists for Hungary Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Hungary Category:Sportspeople from Budapest Category:World record setters in swimming Category:Olympic bronze medalists in swimming Category:Medalists at the 1952 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1948 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic gold medalists in swimming Category:Olympic silver medalists in swimming
title: Éva Novák-Gerard
